title: 820-00923 water damage 5v no ppbus
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 79947, member: 682"]
How do you get 5V without power on the chip???
[/QUOTE]
I dont know :rolleyes: 
U6903:
1.  P3V3G3H_VBST - 5V 
2. PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H 0V (C6906)
3. P3V3G3H_LX 0V (L6900)
5,7. P3V3G3H_AGND 0V (C6910) full short dido mode 001
8. P3V3G3H_BIAS 0V (U6910)
9. P3V3G3H_FB 0V (R6910/11)
10. PM_EN_P3V3_G3H 0v (dot near)

title: 820-00923 water damage 5v no ppbus
message:
USB-meter going off with battery, doesn't mean charger is shorted!
You can create confusion if don't explain the symptoms correctly.
In your case, the charger get blocked, when battery is connected; we should find why.

Do you have same behaviour on all USB-C ports?
Check them in both directions.

title: 820-00923 water damage 5v no ppbus
message:
I suppose you've reffered to D6902.
CPU got hot because its embedded PCH was sinking too much current from 3V3_G3H; probably through RTC power rail.
This also explains overheating D6902...

title: 820-00923 water damage 5v no ppbus

Are you sure isn't U6903 the burnt one?
U7000 requires to communicate with SMC, which requires 3V3_G3H to work.
Check EN_VR1 output of U7000.
